body.p:
Princeton Kentucky December 7" 1863
Gov Thos E Bramlette
Frankfort Ky
Dr Sir

At the November Term 1863 of the Caldwell Circuit Court a Judgment was rendered in favor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky against Newman Estes John Lewis and William Wells for the sum of Seven Thousand Dollars $7000= as the sureties and bail for One James A Johnson on a charge of Murder = I have examined and read the Petition of said Newman Estes John Lewis and William Wells= addressed to you and find the statements made therein substantially correct= said James A Johnson was sent out of the county and then sent South and exchanged to Military Order as I was informed and believe= I know that he was arrested and carried off to Colonel A.. P.. Henry 15 Kentucky Calvalry
and I afterwards heard that James A Johnson had been sent to Johnson= Island and from there sent South and exchanged and I know that he has never been back in the county since he was arrested and carried Off to Colonel Henry in November Or December 1862 = that I have ever heard of = and there is a report in circulation here that said James A Johnson is now dead Whether time or not I am unable to say with any certainty = William Wells one of the parties in said -- Judgment is utterly Worthless and insolvent and can not pay One Dollar= Newman Estes is an Old Man and has a family John Lewis also has a family = and it will take about all both Estes and Lewis have to pay said Judgment for said sum of $7000= and there is very little hope or chance for indemnity from Johnson if he is either now living Or dead and I am well satisfied that they have no indem
nity from Johnson to serve them from coss and liability on said bail bond and Judgment for $7000= and in consideration of the above and foregoing facts I would ask in behalf of said Newman Estes John Lewis and William Wells Your interposition and that you = release said parties from the payment of said Judgment except all fees and costs thereon=

I am Yours Respectfully
E P Campbell
Comth Atty 2nd District
